intro: Naucleopsis ulei subsp. ulei, commonly known as the African flame tree, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its showy, flame-red bracteate inflorescences. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a smooth or slightly hairy surface. The flowers are small and clustered, often surrounded by brightly colored bracts that serve to attract pollinators.
